title: Code Engine
introduction: Find out how you can use Code Engine to run your containerized workloads

section_recommended.title: Code Engine release notes
section_recommended.description: Learn about the latest changes to Code Engine.

section_recommended.title: Managing projects
section_recommended.description: Learn how to create and work with a Code Engine project.

section_recommended.title: Working with apps
section_recommended.description: An application, or app, runs your code to serve HTTP requests. The number of running instances of an app are automatically scaled up or down (to zero) based on incoming requests and your configuration settings.

section_recommended.title: Working with jobs and job runs
section_recommended.description: A job runs one or more instances of your executable code in parallel. Jobs are designed to run one time and exit. When you create a job, you can specify workload configuration information that is used each time that the job is run.

section_recommended.title: Working with functions
section_recommended.description: A Function is a stateless code snippet that performs tasks in response to an HTTP request.
